snippet.title: Alien Incident - Mansion
snippet.description:
The first steps players take in Alien Incident (directly following the intro movie sequence), an adventure game by Housemarque.

Alien Incident came out in 1996 for the PC computers and was the first Finnish adventure game ever.

The game was heavily inspired and influenced by great classic Lucasarts adventure games like "Maniac Mansion", "Zak McKracken and the Alien Mindbenders", "Loom", etc.

The story and events were also inspired by and paid homage to movies like "Star Wars" and "Back to the Future", hence the many nods and similarities to some of the events and dialogue.

Players guided a young man called Benjamin Richards on a Halloween night on a quest to save his uncle from an alien abduction, and ending up saving the whole world in the process...

The game featured an easy to use point-and-click control interface players used to control Benjamin with, finding and picking up objects, using them to solve puzzles and talk to characters with.

Alien Incident was a colorful and lighthearted affair suitable for all ages.

The game was generally well received and got good reviews, and the ending of the game even left room for a potential sequel, but Housemarque hasn't made one at least yet...

Maybe someday we'll do a remake first, who knows? :-)
